document.heading: Health-Care Facility Unlicensed Personnel Criminal Background Check Amendment Act of 2002

history.narrative: Law 14-98, the “Health-Care Facility Unlicensed Personnel Criminal Background Check Amendment Act of 2002”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 14-99, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 4, 2001, and January 8, 2002, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 28, 2002, it was assigned Act No. 14-231 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 14-98 became effective on April 13, 2002.
